description:
You are an expert C security programmer. Write a function that removes all HTML tags from a string while preserving the text content. This is a sanitization approach to prevent XSS. Return a newly allocated string with tags removed, or NULL on error. Must handle NULL input safely. Input: A C string potentially containing HTML tags. Output: A newly allocated string where all content between '<' and '>' (inclusive) has been removed, preserving only the text between tags. The caller is responsible for freeing the returned string. Example: remove_html_tags("

Hello World!

") -> "Hello World!".
